headline: World's Best Honey Garlic Pork Chops
description: A quick and simple grilled pork chop recipe that everyone will love featuring a simple and easy glaze of ketchup, honey, soy sauce, and garlic.

video.description: A quick and simple grilled pork chop that everyone will love featuring a simple and easy glaze!
video.name: World‚Äôs Best Honey Garlic Pork Chops

name: World's Best Honey Garlic Pork Chops

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Gather ingredients.
Whisk ketchup, honey, soy sauce, and garlic together in a bowl to make a glaze.

Sear the pork chops on both sides on the preheated grill. Lightly brush glaze onto each side of the chops as they cook; grill until no longer pink in the center, about 7 to 9 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I buy them in 5 pound packages not to thick and marinate and freeze i always added those ingredient sometimes i add a splash of hot sauce or a dab of mustard or some rosemary or a little extra brown sugar. I then pull them out 360 degrees- 10 minutes air fryer easy meal .

Used the NInja Foodi air fryer with a grill plate. Cooked to 145-150 but was still a little pink. Chops were at least 1 1/2" thick. Needed toc ook longer so I ate the outer rim and saved the center for reheat Tomorrow. Pork Chops were nice and juicy with lots of flavor.

Excellent recipe. I use the sauce on pork roast and chicken as well. I just go a little lighter on the Ketsup. Sometimes I will use maple syrup if I‚Äôm out of honey. Easy to put together quickly. My family loves it.
Really good!!
Absolutely wonderful, delicious, and easy to make. My family loved them. I did not change a thing.
Made this 2 weeks ago will make it again tonight I think it was really good cooked on wood burning grill üëç
good and traditional for grilled chops. I ran out of ketchup, so I supplemented with bbq sauce.

This recipe rocks! It's so easy to throw together, with ingredients that most folks have in their pantry. We only had 1/2 inch chops--ten of them--and between four of us, three of us and a neighbor--all ten no longer exist in the world. The sauce is basically a BBQ sauce and provides the chops with a memorable, juicy flavor, as long as they are not overcooked. I didn't end up with a glaze, but the sauce was so good, it didn't matter. I suspect if I flash-broil the chops for a bit, after grilling, that I'd get a nice glaze.
It was raining out, so I baked it. Taste was yummy, but next time I want to grill it because it looked better in the photos.
Used my cast iron pan and they turned out great I add some red pepper flakes and siracha for spice when feeling frisky! Will make again!

O.K so I mixed the glaze as per the recipe, seared the pork chops and rendered the fat by just frying it on the fat. I then glased one side, face up, turned it over, glazed, turned it over 30 sec each,them moved them to a baking tray. This used half the glaze. Then I baked on grill 250 degrees. Glaze side up. 5 mins, flip and repeat. This prevented that black carbon forming from that high temp. Both sides glazed under grill and it was PERFECT.
Not at all. It had a very bland taste and did not glaze. It ran off the pork like water.
They were good. I‚Äôm not a huge pork person but the sauce was amazing..
It was such a success with the kids they loved it.

We thought that this recipe was outstanding. I brined a 2 1/2‚Äù thick double chop for 12 hours. The only changes I made to the sauce were to use 1/4 cup honey and 3 large pressed garlic cloves. I did make the quantity of sauce shown for 6 chops, and did end up using most of it for cooking our 1 double chop. I began the chop on high heat on my grill, having sprayed it first with avocado oil. After searing both sides and the fatty top, I lowered the heat to medium and/or medium low, turning every 3 minutes and basting with each turn. It took 30 minutes to reach 145 degrees and it was tender and succulent. My hat‚Äôs off to Chef John!
I halved the recipe and used 2 thick-cut pork chops. It was tasty, but the predominant flavor was ketchup. I might try again with more soy sauce.

Loved the sauce in this recipe. I made extra sauce so we would have extra. The pork chops sturned out amazing! Juicy & tender. This was truly a quick & easy recipe as well. It is going to be a regular in our house.
I really like the sauce. The final product wasn't that good. I'll make the sauce again for other BBQ.
Just saw it want to try
Best flavoured pork chops, even my grandsons loved it!

I seared mine in the weeknight pan. I put a little more garlic than in the recipe (we like garlic). After the 10 pork chops, I had extra sauce left over. I cleaned the stainless with some white vinegar and used the remaining mixture to make a nice Glaze topping. It was awesome. My wife loves it.
I used pork loins and it came out fine. That sweet n tangy flavor melted my taste buds
Great marinade for bone in pork!
I just made these tonight and they were spectacular.
Excellent recipe... Easy, fast and delish!
I made this and it was very easy to make. I used George Foreman‚Äôs grill which worked perfect. Will continue using this website.
Absolutely delicious
Easy recipe the only thing I did different was cooked the chops a little first before I the sauce on
Fabulous. I followed the recipe exactly and grilled the chops, They were truly outstanding.
Definitely a do over! So good!

I made this tonight and my husband loved it. We had tomatoes, okra, and rice with it. Very tasty. I will make this again. I lightly seasoned my meat with Lawry's season salt, black pepper, and added 1/2 teaspoon of granulated sugar.

Did these on the grill as instructed and basted throughout. Chops were really good! Maybe not the ‚Äúbest‚Äù but ok-good. A little too sweet for our preference. An easy recipe and was worth trying. Thank you.
I followed the recipe exactly and cooked it indoors on the George Foreman grill. It was excellent: tender and tasty. Definitely will make it again.
I made this exactly like the recipe stated. My only suggestion is to make sure you save some of the glaze for dipping after the pork chops are done. It is absolutely delicious!!
It was outstanding, had planned on putting it on the grill, but it started raining so I did it in the oven for 25 minutes then 4 minutes in the broiler turned out great
No substitutions, first time making this, turned out great! Served with baked potatoes. Simple and easy, but big on taste!
Loved it! I cooked mine on 350‚Äô for 45 min as suggested by someone else. I will be making this again!
I used bone in pork chops scored them then spiced with all recipes world famous pork rub for awhile then bbq and slather them awesomely delicious
I am not a pork chop kind of person so I made it with bone in chicken thighs and it was amazing!
love it
I followed the recipe exactly as it called for and I only have one word. WOW!!!!!!!

I was expecting more flavor from the glaze. It was fine, but not "world's best." If I were to make this again, I'd add a couple of drops of sriracha, or something to give it a little more zing. As it was, it was a perfectly serviceable glaze that is very easy and quick to make, and that adds a nice flavor.

These were fabulous. Looking at the ingredient list I was skeptical, but we loved it. Made it as written the first time, but the second time made some minor changes. I doubled the garlic, which I think improved on an already really good glaze. I also flipped the chops every 2 minutes and brushed them with more glaze. It added a little more dimension to the finished product. I should add that drying the chops off before searing them is an important step--dont' skip it or your glaze will just slide off the meat.
Fine, nothing special.
I used this on chicken thighs on the grill and it was very good. A lightly flavored marinade that added a great taste to the meat.
This isn't a very tasty way to cook pork chops. The sauce is too sweet and doesn't add very good flavours to your pork chops. I would suggest stick to a dry rub pork chop with a reverse sear.
It was a nice change. Not too sweet but not tangy at all. Would also be good with chicken.
Sauce is very tasty! double sauce and have some aside to add after grilling if desired. easy and very tasty.

WOW!! Love the taste of the Garlic Pork Chops!! My girlfriends loved them too!!

Delicious!!
Loved the sauce recipe, but next time I will marinate to get more of the flavor into the meat. I chose to bake instead of grill, 350F for 20 mins. Pork chops came out around 150F....very tender!

LIke many other reviewers, I changed all the ingredients and times but LOVE this recipe! I don't really understand what a recipe is but if you just read this recipe, swap out whatever it is you don't want or don't have for something COMPLETELY DIFFERENT, you're going to wind up with something you love because it's not this recipe AT ALL!!!!!
The sauce was great and very tastey
Amazing!!!!! It‚Äôs always the simple recipes that will amaze you!
Yummy simple sauce. Hubby did the chops on the big green egg and put the glaze on near the end of cooking.? simple
I baked these too, 350 for 45-50 min, uncovered. My family LOVED them!!
I‚Äôd do it again
Made this for a change in taste for a pork night. My entire family loved it, including my "won't eat anything" father-in-law. Thank you for sharing!!
Really easy and delicious! I would definitely make this again :)
Everyone loved this. I didn‚Äôt have fresh garlic, used garlic powder, otherwise stuck with the recipe. Delicious.

As far as the sauce goes, YUM! Loved by all. That said, I also decided to put these in the oven rather than the grill. I turned the broiler on high, salted the naked pork chops, and broiled them for about 6-7 minutes on each side. Then, I dabbed them with a paper towel to absorb the moisture, brushed them with the sauce, and put them back in the oven for another 1-2 minutes. Repeated on the other side. Came out tasty, and will make them again!

After reading other reviewer‚Äôs I decided to put this in the oven as well. I preheated my oven to 350¬∞ and seared the pork chops on each side and then placed into a 9 x 13 Pyrex. We cooked for pork chops

I give this five stars, very delicious sauce one of the best pork chops I‚Äôve tried. Unfortunately it won‚Äôt allow me to upload my photo even if I am trying to size it down, but I have shared on my Facebook as well as my Instagram and this is an amazing recipe 

Picky child eater approved !!!
Sauce too runny when done on grill. Think too much ketchup. Sauce not stick to meat came off in bottom of grill. Is a tasty sauce. Would try in oven next

I made it!!! (Minus the garlic ‚Äúyuk‚Äù)
Very good.

Subbed the soy sauce for some sweet chilli and oyster sauce. Added a splash of vinegar to cut through the richness of the glaze. When I was done brushing on the sauce, I placed the rest in a small sauce pan to cook the raw garlic a little and served it on the side as a sauce. 10/10 would recommend.

My boyfriend seemed to like this recipe and it tasted better the next day- to be fair. I‚Äôm just surprised it has so many raving reviews because it quite literally tastes like ketchup. I‚Äôd expected the other ingredients would obscure the ketchupy taste a bit, but it‚Äôs a ketchup marinade basically, which isn‚Äôt that exciting. Maybe my pallete is different or more advanced than the reviewers here but for all the rave I expected something more than a keychupy taste. Other things taste great with ketchup like burgers and hotdogs and fries but if I‚Äôm gonna actually ‚Äúcook‚Äù something and ‚Äúmarinade‚Äù it I don‚Äôt want it to taste like something a college student quickly put together. Or for it to taste like artificially sweetened tomatoes when I could just use either real tomatoes or something closer to a real tomato taste like a dash of tomato paste and other ingredients. So I‚Äôm definitely still on the look out for a bomb pork marinade that doesn‚Äôt taste like ketchup. But if you want something fast that at least my boyfriend seemed to like enough, I suppose this will do. I tossed it in the oven and turned it every 15 or so, slathering the recipe amount of the ketchup marinade on it.
Excellent!!! A new family favorite.
Very good did it on a grill pan but it‚Äôs amazing for real

I just made this because we are grilling almost exclusively due to the heat and I needed something new to try. It was delicious! My husband loved it as well. If you are on the fence to try this just make it and know it is amazing. Thank you for the simple, quick and flavorful recipe.
The sauce is awesome! BBqed the pork chops and they came out awesome. Will definitely make again. Trying the same sauce on grilled chicken legs today.
Yummy!
Really great!!
My family love it! Need to try sumthing new and we dont eat port that much so it was a nice change! Will always make it like this for now on! Thanks
This is my go to marinade. Very easy and always tasty. Sometimes I cut the recipe in half as many times I cook three pork chops. Would be good on chicken too. I don‚Äôt do any substitutions.
This was awesome. I added a pinch of dried hot peppers for some zip. Yummy
Delicious! Lick your plate good!
These were really fantastic. Just excellent, especially for only a couple ingredients, I was really surprised how much I liked this.
Delicious

Really liked the glaze/sauce for the grilled pork chops. Simple ingredients most people already have in the kitchen. I made the full recipe for only 2 very thick pork chops. I marinated them in 1/2 the sauce for about an hour as one person recommended before I put them on the grill. Came out very tasty. I‚Äôd probably double the glaze if I was making more than 2 chops. I‚Äôll definitely make them again.
This was very tasty and I will definitely make it again. I doubled the garlic but otherwise followed the recipe. I put the sauce in the fridge for several hours before using.

I absolutely love this glaze. Easy to prepare and even easier to customize. I'll definitely be making this one again ASAP. The family loved this one as well. Great recipe to make if your in a hurry to prepare something hearty and delicious.
I baked it and it turned out great. Reminded me of how my mom used to make our porkchops.
This is easy to make and taste great. My only problem with it is using ketchup! I prefer a more savory bbq sauce.
A awesome recipe for port chops

Instead of grilling them i cut up the pork chops and cooked them in a pan and then while that cooked i made the glaze and once the pork chop pieces were cooked i put the glaze in and mixed and let it reach a boil and then once that was done i put it on top of rice and my whole family loved and im only 16 and i like to cook so this was a really good recipe to use
I added a splash of soy vay spiced chili sauce And used the leftover sauce on burgers the next day.
No chargers was very good
Good.
These were pretty good. Flavor was good. I am someone who prefers things with strong flavors or else I would've given it 5 stars.
I made this last night except I grilled a pork tenderloin and put it on instead of pork chops. Very good
Baked in oven absolutely wonderful.

This was delicious. My picky 11 year old LOVED it, so that is a win!!!
Nice sweet and tangy.
Just meh for our family.

So good! We have 7 kiddos so finding good meals that they also enjoy is pretty challenging. This one was a hit wit the whole family. Saved for several future dinners!! ? Amazing with Parmesan crusted lemon butter red potatoes!
I Made these chops but adjusted the recipe to my needs and they were a hit !! I used center but boneless pork chops , pan dear both sides pop Em in the oven and glazed twice ... so yummy
Recipe was great I use garlic powder and add onion powder to it
It was delicious! I only used 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, I didn't have low sodium soy sauce.
Great recipe. Seared on the stovetop and added sauce and then baked at 350¬∞. Delicious!

I loved this recipe! I didnt grill it. I browned the chops in a pan and made the glaze aside. Once they were all brown and cooked, I added the glaze and let them cook while covered for about 10-15mins more. 

Great simple recipe! Thank you!
Amazing recipe!!

item.name: World's Best Honey Garlic Pork Chops
